definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Beijing's courtyard there is a hierarchy, is the patriarchal system.
sentences.chinese: 北京的四合院是有等級的，是家長制的。

sentences.english: Recognizing the child's right of participation means to challenge the paternalist.
sentences.chinese: 承認兒童的參與權也意味着對家長制作風的否定。

sentences.english: The Kentucky high court decided that in loco parentis justified that rule.
sentences.chinese: 肯塔基州高院決定家長制符合這個規則。

sentences.english: Among the women and children, a matriarchal system often prevails;
sentences.chinese: 在只有婦女和小孩時，女家長制盛行。

sentences.english: The time has come to turn away from the condescending policies of paternalism.
sentences.chinese: 如今已到了揚棄那種家長制的降格相求政策的時刻。

sentences.english: In some places, the headmaster -in -charge system has become autocracy.
sentences.chinese: 在有些地方，校長負責製成了“家長制”。

sentences.english: It was the extension of the patriarchal system to the entire nation.
sentences.chinese: 這是延長了家長制，以整個國家。

sentences.english: They are presented as patriarchal Bedouin chiefs.
sentences.chinese: 他們被描寫爲父權家長制的貝都印式酋長。
